intro: Genista linifolia subsp. pallida, commonly known as the pale broom, is a low-growing shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are narrow and linear, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland valleys. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
